verses.roman:
vāmana hañā yena cānda dharibāre cāya
aneka yatna kainu, tāte kabhu siddha naya

synonyms: vāmana hañā—being a dwarf; yena—as if; cānda—the moon; dharibāre—to catch; cāya—wants; aneka yatna—many attempts; kainu—I have made; tāte—in that; kabhu siddha naya—I have not been successful.
translation: "Like a dwarf who wants to catch the moon, I have tried my best many times, but I have never been successful.
